rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
statement_text: If you look at the cases that have occurred since 1997, when it [H5N1] first emerged in human cases in Hong Kong, through to mid-2015 to 2016, those years were by far the highest-risk situation. We’ve seen very few cases in humans since then [mid-2015/2016]. And part of that [the reason for very few human cases] is that the virus has changed—it [the virus]’s mutated to the point of where it is infecting other mammalian species and birds at an increasing rate. But we’ve had no evidence yet that [the change/mutation allowing infection of mammals/birds]’s happened for humans or for pigs.

rationale: 'highest-risk situation' does not fit the Q2 criteria for superlative + harm noun or intensifier + harm noun.
